intro: Odontotrichum amplifolium, commonly known as the broad-leafed odontotrichum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, grassy areas and is native to regions of Europe and Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
